info.name: store
info.description: This is api documentation for store project by Aren talb

item.name: v1
user data & auth

request.description:
### Register User

This endpoint allows the client to register a new user.

#### Request Body

- `username` (string, required): The username of the new user.
- `email` (string, required): The email address of the new user.
- `password` (string, required): The password for the new user.

Example:

``` json
{
  "username": "example_username",
  "email": "user@example.com",
  "password": "example_password"
}
```

#### Response

- Status: 201
- Content-Type: application/json

The response will contain the following fields:

- `status` (string): Indicates the status of the registration request.
- `data` (string): Additional data related to the registration.

Example:

``` json
{
  "status": "success",
  "data": "User registered successfully"
}

### Auth Logout

This endpoint is used to log out the user from the application.

#### Request Body

- email (string, required): The email of the user.
- password (string, required): The password of the user.
    

#### Response

- status (string): The status of the logout operation.
- data (string): Additional data related to the logout operation.
    

#### Example

Request:

```
{
  "email": "user@example.com",
  "password": "********"
}

 ```

Response:

```
{
  "status": "success",
  "data": "User logged out successfully"
}

 ```

header.value: accessToken=; Max-Age=0; Path=/; Expires=Thu, 20 Jun 2024 02:01:47 GMT; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=None
refreshToken=; Max-Age=0; Path=/; Expires=Thu, 20 Jun 2024 02:01:47 GMT; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=None

exec: // Check if the response has accessToken and refreshToken
// Get the access token and refresh token from the response
// Set the access token and refresh token as environment variables
console.log('Access and refresh tokens set successfully.');
// If the access token or refresh token is not found, log an error
console.log('Access token or refresh token not found in the response.');

request.description:
### Auth Login

This endpoint is used to authenticate a user and obtain access and refresh tokens.

#### Request Body

- `email` (string, required): The email of the user.
- `password` (string, required): The password of the user.
    

#### Response

- `status` (string): The status of the response.
- `data` (object):
    - `username` (string): The username of the authenticated user.
    - `email` (string): The email of the authenticated user.
    - `role` (string): The role of the authenticated user.
    - `isVerified` (boolean): Indicates if the user is verified.
    - `accessToken` (string): The access token for the authenticated user.
    - `refreshToken` (string): The refresh token for the authenticated user.

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "username": "",
        "email": "",
        "role": "",
        "isVerified": true,
        "accessToken": "",
        "refreshToken": ""
    }
}

 ```

header.value: refreshToken=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6IjY2NjMyMGRmOTZhMDRjMDZhNDExOWE1MCIsImlhdCI6MTcxODg0ODk4OCwiZXhwIjoxNzE5NzEyOTg4fQ.LEMllvl5nXYQ1yhlJW-cY_7LDZYmUvx61q4G995Kd0U; Max-Age=864000; Path=/; Expires=Sun, 30 Jun 2024 02:03:08 GMT; HttpOnly; Secure; SameSite=None

exec: // Set the access token as an environment variable

request.description:
### Verify Email Confirmation

This endpoint is used to verify the email confirmation by providing the token in the query parameter.

#### Request

- Method: GET
- URL: `{{BASE_URL}}/auth/verify-email/confirm`
- Query Parameters:
    - `token`: (string) The token for email verification.

#### Response

Upon successful execution, the endpoint returns a JSON object with the following properties:

- `status`: (string) The status of the verification process.
- `data`: (string) Additional data related to the verification process.
    

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": ""
}

 ```

This endpoint allows the user to request a password reset by sending a POST request to {{BASE_URL}}/auth/password-reset/request. The request should include a JSON payload in the raw request body type with the user's email address.

### Request Body

| Key | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| email | text | The email address of the user requesting the password reset. |

### Response

Upon successful execution, the endpoint returns a 200 status with a JSON response in the content type "application/json". The response includes the following fields:

- `status`: Indicates the status of the request.
- `data`: Contains additional data related to the password reset request.
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": ""
}

 ```

request.description:
### Get User Details
This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific user with the provided user ID.

#### Request
- Method: GET
- URL: `{{BASE_URL}}/users/admin/66718ad52cf1e09a59c45051`

#### Response
- Status: 200
- Content-Type: application/json
- Body:
  ```json
  {
    "status": "",
    "data": {
      "_id": "",
      "username": "",
      "email": "",
      "role": "",
      "active": true,
      "isVerified": true,
      "createdAt": "",
      "updatedAt": ""
    }
  }
  ```
  The response contains the user's details including user ID, username, email, role, active status, verification status, creation date, and last update date.

This endpoint allows users to update their password using an HTTP PUT request to {{BASE_URL}}/users/change-password.

### Request Body
The request body should be in raw JSON format and include the following parameters:
- `oldPassword`: (string) The user's current password.
- `newPassword`: (string) The new password to be set.

### Response
The response will have a status code of 200 and a content type of application/json. The response body will consist of a JSON object with the following schema:
```json
{
  "status": "",
  "data": ""
}
```
The user can expect the `status` field to contain a message indicating the outcome of the password change operation, and the `data` field to potentially hold additional information related to the operation.

### Update User Admin

This endpoint is used to update the details of a specific admin user.

#### Request Body

- `active` (boolean): Specifies whether the user is active or not.
- `role` (string): Specifies the role of the user.
    

#### Response

The response will include the following:

- `status` (string): Indicates the status of the request.
- `data` (string): Additional data related to the request.
    

#### Example

Request:

``` json
{
  "active": true,
  "role": ""
}

 ```

Response:

``` json
{
  "status": "",
  "data": ""
}

 ```

request.description:
### GET /products/66718a462cf1e09a59c45043

#### Description

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific product identified by the provided ID.

#### Request

No request body for this endpoint.

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "status": "string",
  "data": {
    "_id": "string",
    "name": "string",
    "description": "string",
    "category": {
      "_id": "string",
      "name": "string",
      "createdAt": "string",
      "updatedAt": "string",
      "__v": 0
    },
    "coverImage": "string",
    "images": ["string"],
    "price": 0,
    "stock": 0,
    "availableStock": 0,
    "tags": ["string"],
    "averageRating": 0,
    "createdAt": "string",
    "updatedAt": "string",
    "__v": 0,
    "reviews": [
      {
        "_id": "string",
        "product": "string",
        "user": {
          "username": "string"
        },
        "rating": 0,
        "comment": "string",
        "createdAt": "string",
        "id": "string"
      }
    ],
    "id": "string"
  }
}

 ```

response.name: get product By id

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve information about new products. The request does not require any specific parameters in the request body.

### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

### Response

Upon a successful execution, the endpoint returns a 200 status code with a JSON response in the following format:

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": [
        {
            "_id": "",
            "name": "",
            "description": "",
            "category": "",
            "coverImage": "",
            "images": [""],
            "price": 0,
            "stock": 0,
            "availableStock": 0,
            "tags": [""],
            "averageRating": 0,
            "createdAt": "",
            "updatedAt": "",
            "__v": 0,
            "id": ""
        }
    ]
}

 ```

The response contains an array of product objects, each with various attributes such as ID, name, description, category, images, price, stock, tags, average rating, and timestamps for creation and last update.

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to create a new product by sending a POST request to the specified URL. The request should include form-data in the body with the following parameters:

- `name` (text): The name of the product.
- `description` (text): A brief description of the product.
- `category` (text): The category to which the product belongs.
- `price` (text): The price of the product.
- `stock` (text): The total stock of the product.
- `availableStock` (text): The available stock of the product.
- `tags[0]`, `tags[1]`, `tags[2]` (text): Optional tags associated with the product.
- `coverImage` (file): The main image of the product.
- `images` (file): Additional images of the product.
    

The response to the request will have a status code of 201 and a JSON content type. The response body will include the newly created product's details, such as the name, description, category, cover image, images, price, stock, available stock, tags, average rating, and other metadata.

request.description:
### Add Category

This endpoint allows the user to add a new category.

**Request Body**

- `name` (string, required): The name of the category to be added.
    

**Response**

- Status: 201 Created
- Content-Type: application/json
- `status` (string): The status of the request.
- `data`
    - `id` (string): The unique identifier of the newly added category.
    - `name` (string): The name of the category that was added.

### Delete Category

This endpoint is used to delete a specific category.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response

- Status: 200
- Content-Type: application/json
- Body:
    
    ``` json
    {
        "status": "",
        "data": ""
    }
    
     ```

### Get Product Review Status

This endpoint retrieves the review status of a specific product.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response

- `status` (string, optional): Represents the status of the response.
- `data` (object): Contains the review status information.
    - `reviewed` (boolean): Indicates whether the product has been reviewed (`true`) or not (`false`).

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "reviewed": true
    }
}

 ```

item.name: get all review for a product

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve the reviews for a specific product. The request should be sent to {{BASE_URL}}/products/66718a462cf1e09a59c45043/reviews.

### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

### Response

The response will include a status and an array of review objects. Each review object contains the following fields:

- _id: The unique identifier for the review
- product: The identifier of the product being reviewed
- user: An object containing the username of the user who submitted the review
- rating: The numerical rating given in the review
- comment: The text of the review comment
- createdAt: The timestamp of when the review was created
- updatedAt: The timestamp of when the review was last updated
- __v: Version control field
- id: The unique identifier for the review (same as _id)

response.name: get all review for a product

item.name: get one review for a prodct

request.description:
### GET /products/{productId}/reviews/{reviewId}

This endpoint retrieves a specific review for a product.

#### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint. The parameters in the URL are as follows:

- `productId` (string): The unique identifier of the product.
- `reviewId` (string): The unique identifier of the review.

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format with the following schema:

```json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "_id": "",
        "product": "",
        "user": {
            "username": ""
        },
        "rating": 0,
        "comment": "",
        "createdAt": "",
        "updatedAt": "",
        "__v": 0,
        "id": ""
    }
}
```
The `status` field indicates the status of the response, and the `data` field contains the details of the review, including its unique identifier (`_id`), the associated product (`product`), the user who posted the review (`user`), the rating given (`rating`), the comment provided (`comment`), creation and update timestamps (`createdAt`, `updatedAt`), and version (`__v`).

response.name: get one review for a prodct

request.description:
### Add Product Review

This API endpoint allows you to add a review for a specific product.

#### Request Body

- `rating` (number): The rating given for the product.
- `comment` (string): The comment or review for the product.
    

Example:

``` json
{
  "rating": 0,
  "comment": ""
}

 ```

#### Response

- Status: 201 Created
- Content-Type: application/json
    

Example Response Body:

``` json
{
  "status": "",
  "data": {
    "product": "",
    "user": "",
    "rating": 0,
    "comment": "",
    "_id": "",
    "createdAt": "",
    "updatedAt": "",
    "__v": 0,
    "id": ""
  }
}

 ```

### Delete Product Review

This endpoint is used to delete a specific review for a product.

#### Request Body
This request does not require a request body.

#### Response
The response for this request is a JSON object with the following properties:

- `status` (string): Represents the status of the response.
- `data` (string): Represents the data related to the response.

Example response:
```json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": ""
}
```

### Get Carts

This endpoint retrieves the details of carts.

**Request Body**
This is a GET request and does not require a request body.

**Response**
- `status` (string): The status of the response.
- `data` (object): The cart data.
  - `_id` (string): The ID of the cart.
  - `user` (string): The user associated with the cart.
  - `items` (array): An array of items in the cart.
    - `product` (string): The product ID.
    - `name` (string): The name of the product.
    - `price` (number): The price of the product.
    - `quantity` (number): The quantity of the product in the cart.
    - `coverImage` (string): The cover image of the product.
    - `_id` (string): The ID of the item.
    - `createdAt` (string): The creation date of the item.
    - `updatedAt` (string): The last update date of the item.
  - `createdAt` (string): The creation date of the cart.
  - `updatedAt` (string): The last update date of the cart.
  - `__v` (number): Version of the cart.
  - `totalPrice` (number): The total price of all items in the cart.
  - `totalQuantity` (number): The total quantity of all items in the cart.
  - `id` (string): The ID of the cart.

**Example Response**
```json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "_id": "",
        "user": "",
        "items": [
            {
                "product": "",
                "name": "",
                "price": 0,
                "quantity": 0,
                "coverImage": "",
                "_id": "",
                "createdAt": "",
                "updatedAt": ""
            }
        ],
        "createdAt": "",
        "updatedAt": "",
        "__v": 0,
        "totalPrice": 0,
        "totalQuantity": 0,
        "id": ""
    }
}
```

### Increment Cart Items

This endpoint allows the client to increment the quantity of a specific product in the cart.

**Request Body**
- productId (string, required): The ID of the product to be incremented in the cart.

**Response**
- status (string): The status of the response.
- data (object): The cart data object containing the updated information.
  - _id (string): The ID of the cart.
  - user (string): The user associated with the cart.
  - items (array): An array of items in the cart, each containing:
    - product (string): The ID of the product.
    - name (string): The name of the product.
    - price (number): The price of the product.
    - quantity (number): The updated quantity of the product.
    - coverImage (string): The cover image of the product.
    - _id (string): The ID of the item.
    - createdAt (string): The creation date of the item.
    - updatedAt (string): The last update date of the item.
  - createdAt (string): The creation date of the cart.
  - updatedAt (string): The last update date of the cart.
  - __v (number): Version key for the cart.
  - totalPrice (number): The total price of all items in the cart.
  - totalQuantity (number): The total quantity of all items in the cart.
  - id (string): The ID of the cart.

**Example Request Body:**
```json
{
  "productId": "example_product_id"
}

This endpoint allows you to update the items in the user's shopping cart. The HTTP PUT request should be sent to {{BASE_URL}}/carts with a payload in the raw request body type containing the productId and quantity of the item to be updated.

### Request Body
- `productId` (string): The ID of the product to be updated.
- `quantity` (number): The new quantity of the product in the cart.

### Response
Upon a successful execution, the endpoint returns a status code of 200 and a JSON response with the following structure:
```json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "_id": "",
        "user": "",
        "items": [
            {
                "product": "",
                "name": "",
                "price": 0,
                "quantity": 0,
                "coverImage": "",
                "_id": "",
                "createdAt": "",
                "updatedAt": ""
            }
        ],
        "createdAt": "",
        "updatedAt": "",
        "__v": 0,
        "totalPrice": 0,
        "totalQuantity": 0,
        "id": ""
    }
}
```
The `data` object contains the updated cart information, including the ID, user, items with details like product, name, price, quantity, cover image, and timestamps, as well as the total price and total quantity of items in the cart.

#### Example Response
```json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "_id": "",
        "user": "",
        "items": [
            {
                "product": "",
                "name": "",
                "price": 0,
                "quantity": 0,
                "coverImage": "",
                "_id": "",
                "createdAt": "",
                "updatedAt": ""
            }
        ],
        "createdAt": "",
        "updatedAt": "",
        "__v": 0,
        "totalPrice": 0,
        "totalQuantity": 0,
        "id": ""
    }
}
```

item.name: get all order of a user
get order detail of a user

request.description:
### GET /metrics

This endpoint retrieves metrics related to sales, orders, and user activity.

#### Request

No request body is required for this endpoint.

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format and will contain the following fields:

- `status` (string, optional): Represents the status of the response.
- `data` (object): Contains the following metrics data:
    - `totalSales` (number): Total sales value.
    - `totalOrders` (number): Total number of orders.
    - `avgOrderValue` (number): Average order value.
    - `topSellingProducts` (array): An array of top selling products, each containing:
        - `totalSold` (number): Total units sold for the product.
        - `productId` (string): ID of the product.
        - `name` (string): Name of the product.
    - `newUsers` (number): Number of new users.

Example response:

``` json
{
  "status": "",
  "data": {
    "totalSales": 0,
    "totalOrders": 0,
    "avgOrderValue": 0,
    "topSellingProducts": [
      {
        "totalSold": 0,
        "productId": "",
        "name": ""
      }
    ],
    "newUsers": 0
  }
}

 ```

response.name: get metrics

item.description: this is the first vertion of this api
